text: hi guys it's angel today 15th day is on
how to store your matcha now if you
purchase matcha before you'll know that
it's kind of an expensive ingredient so
I want you guys to be able to properly
store it at home so keep these three
tips in mind and you'll be good to go
number one matcha is a delicate powder
and when it's ground up in its leaf form
into its powdered form it really only
has a one year shelf life and that's
when stored in optimal conditions and
that's why when you might watch it it's
typically sold in small vacuum sealed
packages the second consideration is
once your matcha package is open they'll
start to oxidize very quickly
it really doesn't like light heat or
even air so you always want to store
your matcha in an airtight container in
a cool dark place and if you do this
your matcha will stay fresh for about 6
to 12 weeks after opening now I've found
that a mason jar a glass mason jar like
this with an airtight lid works really
well to store your matcha I just make
sure that I store this away from light
and heat so I just put it in my tea
drawer and it really helps to extend the
life of my matcha finally what happens
when matcha expires well if you
purchased a high quality matcha it
should be bright green and vibrant in
color and over time or if stored
improperly the nutrients will start to
degrade and so will the health benefits
and you'll notice that the powder starts
to take on a darker green dull green
color now it doesn't mean you can't use
it it just means the freshness taste and
health benefits won't all be there so
it's best to consume matcha when it's
fresh and vibrant just keep these three
tips in mind and you'll be on your way
to properly storing and enjoying fresh
matcha at home
I hope you guys enjoyed today's tip
Tuesday don't forget to give me eight
if you found this tip helpful and join
me next week for another kitchen tip
I'll see you guys soon bye
